meanings.definition: (of a cell or nucleus) having a single set of unpaired chromosomes
meanings.sent1: The haploid cell contained only one set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the haploid organisms in the lab.
meanings.sent3: The haploid cell felt lonely with its solo set of chromosomes.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of cells, the haploid one stood out like a single star in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The haploid characteristic made the cell unique among its peers.

meanings.definition: an organism or cell having only one complete set of chromosomes
meanings.sent1: The haploid was a key subject in genetic research.
meanings.sent2: The haploid divided to form gametes for reproduction.
meanings.sent3: The haploid enjoyed being the solo chromosome superstar.
meanings.sent4: In the genetic dance, the haploid moved gracefully with its single set.
meanings.sent5: The haploid's simplicity made it essential for genetic diversity.
